revised_title: Duiker Ecology and Blood Parasites in Central Africa
tldr: This study investigates the ecology of duikers in Central Africa and their blood parasites. Researchers discovered Plasmodium (Vinckeia) cephalophi and P. (V.) brucei in Malawi, and detailed the course of blood infection in a naturally infected splenectomized antelope. The study also found theileri-like trypanosomes in duikers, which are common in other ruminants. The research includes various aspects of duiker ecology, management, and health, such as feeding habits, behavior, and parasite infections.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Behavior
